org.jlab.coda.xmsg.core

Class xMsg

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jlab.coda.xmsg.core.xMsg
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Publisher, Subscriber, SyncPublisher

    public class xMsg
extends java.lang.Object

    xMsg base class that provides methods for organizing pub/sub communications. This class provides a local database of xMsgCommunication for publishing and/or subscribing messages without requesting registration information from the local registrar services. This class also provides a thread pool for servicing received messages (as a result of a subscription) in separate threads.

    Since:
    1.0

    • Constructor Detail

      • xMsg

        public xMsg(java.lang.String feHost)
     throws xMsgException,
            java.net.SocketException

        Constructor, requires the name of the FrontEnd host that is used to create a connection to the registrar service running within the xMsgFE. Creates the zmq context object and thread pool for servicing received messages in a separate threads.

        Parameters:
        feHost - host name of the FE
        Throws:
        xMsgException
        java.net.SocketException

    int pool_size)
     throws xMsgException,
            java.net.SocketException

        Constructor, requires the name of the FrontEnd host that is used to create a connection to the registrar service running within the xMsgFE. Creates the zmq context object and thread pool for servicing received messages in a separate threads.

        Parameters:
        feHost - host name of the FE
        pool_size - thread pool size for servicing subscription callbacks
        Throws:
        xMsgException
        java.net.SocketException

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        public xMsgConnection connect()
                       throws xMsgException,
                              java.net.SocketException

        Connects to the xMsgNode by creating two sockets for publishing and subscribing/receiving messages. It returns and the same time stores in the local connection database created xMsgConnection object. This constructor makes connection to the local xMsg node, i.e. xMsgNode should be running on the localhost.

        Returns:
        xMsgConnection object
        Throws:
        xMsgException
        java.net.SocketException

      • connect

        public xMsgConnection connect(xMsgAddress address)
                       throws xMsgException

        Connects to the xMsgNode by creating two sockets for publishing and subscribing/receiving messages. It returns and the same time stores in the local connection database created xMsgConnection object.

      • getNewConnection

        public xMsgConnection getNewConnection(xMsgAddress address)
                                throws xMsgException

        Connects to the xMsgNode by creating two sockets for publishing and subscribing/receiving messages. This is method will be used in case one need to have multiple threads using the same zmq socket. Note: do not try to use the same socket from multiple threads. Each thread should create it's own zmq socket and a context.

        Parameters:
        address - xMsgAddress object
        Returns:
        xMsgConnection object
        Throws:
        xMsgException

      • registerPublisher

        public void registerPublisher(java.lang.String name,
                     java.lang.String host,
                     int port,
                     java.lang.String domain,
                     java.lang.String subject,
                     java.lang.String type)
                       throws xMsgRegistrationException

        If you are periodically publishing data, use this method to register yourself as a publisher with the local registrar. This is necessary for future subscribers to discover and listen to your messages.

        Parameters:
        name - the name of the requester/sender. Required according to the xMsg zmq message structure definition. (topic, sender, data)
        host - host of the xMsg node where the caller is running
        port - port of the xMsg node where the caller is running
        domain - domain of the xMsg subscription
        subject - subject of the subscription
        type - type of the subscription
        Throws:
        xMsgRegistrationException

      • registerPublisher

        public void registerPublisher(java.lang.String name,
                     java.lang.String domain,
                     java.lang.String subject,
                     java.lang.String type)
                       throws xMsgRegistrationException

        If you are periodically publishing data, use this method to register yourself as a publisher with the local registrar. This is necessary for future subscribers to discover and listen to your messages.

        Parameters:
        name - the name of the requester/sender. Required according to the xMsg zmq message structure definition. (topic, sender, data)
        domain - domain of the xMsg subscription
        subject - subject of the subscription
        type - type of the subscription
        Throws:
        xMsgRegistrationException

      • registerSubscriber

        public void registerSubscriber(java.lang.String name,
                      java.lang.String host,
                      int port,
                      java.lang.String domain,
                      java.lang.String subject,
                      java.lang.String type,
                      java.lang.String description)
                        throws xMsgRegistrationException

        If you are a subscriber and want to listen messages on a specific topic from a future publishers, you should register yourself as a subscriber with the local registrar. Future publishers might express an interest to publish data to a a required topic of interest or might publish data only if there are active listeners/subscribers to their published topic.

        Parameters:
        name - the name of the requester/sender. Required according to the xMsg zmq message structure definition. (topic, sender, data)
        host - host of the xMsg node where the caller is running
        port - port of the xMsg node where the caller is running
        domain - domain of the xMsg subscription
        subject - subject of the subscription
        type - type of the subscription
        description - description
        Throws:
        xMsgRegistrationException

      • registerSubscriber

        public void registerSubscriber(java.lang.String name,
                      java.lang.String domain,
                      java.lang.String subject,
                      java.lang.String type,
                      java.lang.String description)
                        throws xMsgRegistrationException

        If you are a subscriber and want to listen messages on a specific topic from a future publishers, you should register yourself as a subscriber with the local registrar. Future publishers might express an interest to publish data to a a required topic of interest or might publish data only if there are active listeners/subscribers to their published topic.

        Parameters:

        domain - domain of the xMsg subscription
        subject - subject of the subscription
        type - type of the subscription
        description - description
        Throws:
        xMsgRegistrationException

      • findPublishers

        public java.util.List<xMsgR.xMsgRegistration> findPublishers(java.lang.String name,

                                                    int port,
                                                    java.lang.String domain,
                                                    java.lang.String subject,
                                                    java.lang.String type)
                                                      throws xMsgDiscoverException

        Finds all global (deployed anywhere in the xMsg cloud, i.e. nodes) publishers, publishing to a specified topic Note: xMsg defines a topic as domain:subject:type

        Parameters:
        name - the name of the requester/sender. Required according to the xMsg zmq message structure definition. (topic, sender, data)
        host - host of the xMsg node where the caller is running
        port - port of the xMsg node where the caller is running
        domain - domain of the xMsg subscription
        subject - subject of the subscription
        type - type of the subscription
        Returns:
        list of xMsgR.xMsgRegistration objects
        Throws:
        xMsgDiscoverException

      • isTherePublisher

        public boolean isTherePublisher(java.lang.String name,
                       java.lang.String host,
                       int port,
                       java.lang.String domain,
                       java.lang.String subject,
                       java.lang.String type)
                         throws xMsgDiscoverException

        Checks the global registration (running on the xMsg FE) to see if there a publisher publishing to a specified topic.

        Parameters:
        name - the name of the requester/sender. Required according to the xMsg zmq message structure definition. (topic, sender, data)
        host - host of the xMsg node where the caller is running
        port - port of the xMsg node where the caller is running
        domain - domain of the xMsg subscription
        subject - subject of the subscription
        type - type of the subscription
        Returns:
        true if at least one publisher is found
        Throws:
        xMsgDiscoverException

                                java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException,

      • subscribe

        public SubscriptionHandler subscribe(xMsgConnection connection,
                            java.lang.String topic,
                            xMsgCallBack cb)
                              throws xMsgException

        Subscribes to a specified xMsg topic. Supplied user callback object must implement xMsgCallBack interface. This method will de-serialize received xMsgData object and pass it to the user implemented callback method of the interface. In the case the request is async the method will utilize private thread pool to run user callback method in a separate thread.

        Parameters:
        connection - socket to a xMsgNode proxy output port.
        topic - topic of the subscription
        cb - xMsgCallBack implemented object reference
        Returns:
        SubscriptionHandler object reference
        Throws:
        xMsgException

      • unsubscribe

        public void unsubscribe(SubscriptionHandler handle)
                 throws xMsgException

        Un-subscribes subscription. This will stop thread and perform xmq un-subscribe

        Parameters:
        handle - SubscribeHandler object reference
        Throws:
        xMsgException

      • getPool_size

        public int getPool_size()

        Returns internal thread pool size

        Returns:
        size of the thread pool
